ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_SMITHS] Digest Number 98
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah, there are also a lot of other molds around some for weapons some for plate some for chain mail. There are also race specific forges and some new kinds of
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah, there are also a lot of other molds around some for weapons some for
plate some for chain mail. There are also race specific forges and some new
kinds of metal and hammers that are also race specific. They haven't
released any recipes for the various items yet (at least we haven't found
them) so nobody knows how to make any of it yet. (would be VERY expensive
to test, some of those molds cost 20-30pp, same with the metals)

----- Original Message -----
From: <EQ_SMITHS@egroups.com>
To: <EQ_SMITHS@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, August 25, 2000 3:02 AM
Subject: [EQ_SMITHS] Digest Number 98


> There is 1 message in this issue.
>
> Topics in this digest:
>
> 1. Smithing Shields
> From: Kris Knowlton <sirkis@...>
________________________________________________________________________
________________________________________________________________________

> Message: 1
> Date: Thu, 24 Aug 2000 10:10:48 -0400 (EDT)
> From: Kris Knowlton <sirkis@...>
> Subject: Smithing Shields
>
> Are shield molds new, or did I just miss them before? I decided to go
check out the plate rumors on the Test server and scoped out the various
smithing books - no changes. However, one of the vendors in E Freeport, Kif
I
> believe, no longer had chain armor, but instead a bunch of shield molds -
over a dozen (to account for the various sizes, I believe). I checked after
the patch yesterday on The Nameless, but there was no change there.
>
> --
> Ellsa Quintess
> Priestess of Bristlebane
> Night Custodian, Chapel of Mischief
> Rivervale Olympic Diving Champion
